questions.question: Which statement best differentiates a database schema from a database instance?
options: Schema changes frequently, instance rarely changes
Schema describes structure, instance describes current data
Instance describes constraints, schema stores values

questions.question: In a conceptual ER model, which of the following is TRUE about relationship cardinality?
options: It is determined only by primary keys
It describes how many entities participate on each side of a relationship
It appears only in physical models

questions.question: Which of the following queries demonstrates a projection in relational algebra?
Which Codd rule ensures metadata must be accessible using the same query language as data?
What will the following SQL do? CREATE TABLE emp AS SELECT id, name FROM staff;
options: Throws an error without PRIMARY KEY

questions.question: Which dependency prevents a relation from being in BCNF?
options: A non-key attribute determines another non-key attribute
A part of composite key determines a non-key attribute
A non-key attribute determines a candidate key
Every attribute depends on whole key

questions.question: Which of the following violates 3NF but satisfies 2NF?
options: A non-key attribute depends on another non-key attribute

questions.question: Which join type can be rewritten using UNION of a LEFT and RIGHT join?
What is the output of the query: SELECT NULL = NULL;
Which MySQL constraint enforces that two rows cannot have identical values across multiple columns?
Which aggregate function counts only non-null values?
Which relational algebra operation is equivalent to SQL DISTINCT?
What is the result of: SELECT 3 IN (NULL, 3, 5);
Which operation will produce a Cartesian product in SQL?
options: SELECT * FROM A JOIN B ON A.id = B.id;
SELECT * FROM A RIGHT JOIN B;
SELECT * FROM A NATURAL JOIN B;

questions.question: In correlated subqueries, the inner query:
options: Runs once before the outer query
Runs for every row of outer query
Runs only if EXISTS is used

questions.question: Which of the following will prevent phantom reads?
Which storage engine ignores foreign keys even if declared?
Which MySQL command displays all available triggers on a table?
In a BEFORE INSERT trigger, which of the following is TRUE?
options: Both NEW and OLD can be modified
Neither NEW nor OLD can be modified

questions.question: Which scenario requires a cursor?
options: Insert all rows from table A into table B
Update salary with same increment for all rows
Perform row-by-row custom logic based on multiple conditions

questions.question: Which type of cursor always reads the most recent committed row?
Which flow control statement always executes at least once?
Which SQL statement is valid for creating a function?
options: CREATE FUNCTION f(x) RETURNS INT BEGIN RETURN x*2; END
CREATE FUNC f RETURNS INT AS RETURN x;
MAKE FUNCTION f RETURNS INT BEGIN END;
DEFINE FUNCTION f(x) AS RETURN x;

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT allowed inside a stored function?
Which of the following views is updatable?
options: A view selecting from one table without aggregations

questions.question: Which SQL query copies structure + data + indexes?
options: CREATE TABLE t2 AS SELECT * FROM t1;
INSERT INTO t2 SELECT * FROM t1;

questions.question: Which index is most efficient for equality searches?
Which command saves the current transaction and ends it?
Which query returns employees whose salary is NOT NULL and above 30000?
options: SELECT * FROM emp WHERE salary != NULL AND salary > 30000;
SELECT * FROM emp WHERE salary IS NOT NULL AND salary > 30000;
SELECT * FROM emp WHERE NOT salary = NULL;

questions.question: Which SQL command removes all rows but keeps table structure?
Which MySQL program is used for database backups?
Which operator performs pattern matching?
Which set operator removes duplicates automatically?
Which table type is automatically deleted when the session ends?
Which of the following is TRUE about NATURAL JOIN?
options: Joins all columns with identical names

questions.question: Which SQL statement will fetch 3rd highest salary?
options: SELECT salary FROM emp ORDER BY salary DESC LIMIT 2,1;
SELECT salary FROM emp GROUP BY salary DESC LIMIT 3;
SELECT salary FROM emp WHERE ROWNUM=3;

questions.question: Which trigger has access only to OLD values?
Which cursor attribute signals that no more rows are available?
options: Handler for NOT FOUND sets flag

questions.question: Which view type stores data physically?
Which relational algebra operation corresponds to SQL WHERE clause?
